author: millerlegodad
title: Sturdy and fun
review: A combination of monster trucks and Legos...  how could you go wrong?  And Lego got it right.  Now, I bought this set and the Star Striker (9094) for my 2-1/2 and 3-1/2 boys (who are very good with the mini Legos).  The age range on the box is 7-12, and I would say that the main reason is the complexity of the build.  There are a significant amount of Technic-style pieces, but they obviously add to the durability of the set.  The main reason my boys wanted these sets is because they are designed to crash into each other...  and they do withstand the crashes!  The minifigs pop out just like designed, and my boys love playing with them so far.  As far as the build...  it was fun enough; the boys put the wheels together (which took some QA by me, unlike standard wheels on other sets), and they built the minifigs.  The actual building was straight-forward and easy to visualize.  Overall, 4 out of 5 bricks for this sturdy little set.
